basic.description: Rigorous application of geomechanics and rock engineering principles to open-ended design problems related to surface and underground excavation, construction and geo-hazard mitigation. Presentation and discussion of design methodologies and case histories are followed up by related analysis and design problems incorporating industry standard software. Emphasis on the inherent variability of geomaterials and implications for integrated site-investigation planning, quantitative risk assessment, design decision-making and performance-monitoring. A field excursion will be included. (0/0/0/12/36)
basic.subject: GEOL
basic.title: Eng Geomechanics & Rock Eng De

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite of GEOL281 and GEOL310 and GEOL321 and registered in a BSCE Academic Program.
